page.title: 05Road Transport
page.content: Newtown and St.Boswells occupy a central position in the Borders area.The main A68 Edinburgh to Newcastle road runs through the villages.It is a very busy road, and at the moment a bypass is under discussion.Some like the idea because they believe it will be safer for children and old people to cross the road.Some people don't like the idea because the route it will take might spoil a wildlife area called the Glen. At the present moment it is believed that work on the Newtown bypass will begin in 1987.Proposals for the St.Boswells bypass have been withdrawn.
